alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Kohala; Kona; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 12 at 3:19AM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND LANAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .An extra-large northwest (330 degrees) swell will be slow to diminish today, then shift to the north (350 degrees) tonight and Friday as it gradually eases. ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Surf of 25 to 35 feet along north facing shores, and 18 to 24 feet along west facing shores of the smaller islands. Surf 12 to 16 feet along west facing shores of Big Island. Surf will gradually diminish tonight. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, north facing shores of Maui and west facing shores of Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...High...Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful longshore and rip currents. Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, with localized beach erosion.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Head all advice from ocean safety officials.
